intro: Senecio jahnii, commonly known as the yellow star grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio jahnii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
